Class StringHolderRenderTransformer

java.lang.Object
com.kohlschutter.stringhold.liqp.StringHolderRenderTransformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
liqp.RenderTransformer
public final class StringHolderRenderTransformer extends Object implements liqp.RenderTransformer
A RenderTransformer that uses StringHolder instances for appending.
Author:
Christian Kohlschütter

  • Method Details

    • getSharedCacheInstance

      public static StringHolderRenderTransformer getSharedCacheInstance()
      Returns the shared StringHolderRenderTransformer instance. This instance shares a common cache for de-duplicating StringHolderSequences, which may help to significantly reduce heap allocation, at the cost of a slightly slower execution. If you're using StringHolderRenderTransformer in a highly concurrent setting, see newCachedInstance() to reduce lock contention.
      Returns:
      The instance.

    • newCachedInstance

      public static StringHolderRenderTransformer newCachedInstance()
      Creates a new, cached StringHolderRenderTransformer instance, using a default maximum length of 64k characters. This instance uses its own cache for de-duplicating StringHolderSequences, which may help to significantly reduce heap allocation, at the cost of a slightly slower execution.
      Returns:
      The instance.

    • newCachedInstance

      public static StringHolderRenderTransformer newCachedInstance(int maximumLength)
      Creates a new, cached StringHolderRenderTransformer instance. This instance uses its own cache for de-duplicating StringHolderSequences, which may help to significantly reduce heap allocation, at the cost of a slightly slower execution.
      Parameters:
      maximumLength - The maximum string length to cache.
      Returns:
      The instance.

    • newUncachedInstance

      public static StringHolderRenderTransformer newUncachedInstance()
      Creates a new, uncached StringHolderRenderTransformer instance. This instance doesn't use a cache for de-duplicating StringHolderSequences, resulting in an overall faster execution at the cost of heap allocations.
      Returns:
      The instance.
